subject: Law
title: LGBTQ+ Adoption Rights
description: A micro-lesson that makes LGBTQ+ Adoption Rights usable.

hook.text: A same-sex couple wants to adopt. The agency refuses on religious grounds. Who does the law protect?

buildup.text: After Obergefell, same-sex couples have equal marriage rights. But adoption laws still vary widely by state.

discovery.text: Some states allow religious agencies to refuse LGBTQ+ applicants. Others require equal treatment for all couples.

twist.text: Fulton v. Philadelphia (2021) sided with a Catholic agency, but on narrow grounds‚Äîwithout creating a broad exemption.

climax.text: The tension between religious freedom and nondiscrimination in adoption remains unresolved at the federal level.

punchline.text: A child needs a home. The law hasn't decided whose beliefs matter more.

quiz.question: What did Fulton v. Philadelphia involve?
options: A religious agency refusing LGBTQ+ foster parents
